document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Neotropical caddisfly genus Banyallarga (Trichoptera: Calamoceratidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Neotropical caddisfly genus Banyallarga (Trichoptera: Calamoceratidae)

mods:name.mods:namePart: Prather Table Of Contents, Aysha L.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Banyallarga yungensis
Flint 1983:79
[ Type locality: Argentina , Pcia. Tucumán , Horco Molle , near Tucumán ; NMNH; male].

Ganonema vicarium
—
Martynov 1912:7
[description of male misidentified as
Ganonema vicarium
].

subSubSection.paragraph:
A number of species in the subgenus
Banyallarga
have the apex of tergum X acute. The male of
B. yungensis
can be separated from those species by the high dorsal ridge of tergum X ( Fig. 14A ).

Head chestnut brown, with dorsomesal crest of golden setae. Maxillary palps dark brown. Antenna twice forewing length, dark brown, each flagellomere pale basally and with narrow patch of pale sensilla on anterior surface. Dorsal pterothorax chestnut brown; ventrolateral thorax and femora golden brown, tibiae covered with dark setae, each tarsomere dark basally and pale distally. Forewing mottled dark brown and gold, nygma marked by golden spot, proximal half of wing posterior mostly bright gold; thyridial cell filled with dark brown setae. Hind wing of male with basal semimembranous sleeve or pouch, enclosing brush of long setae.
